place.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: a space or area, for example a particular point on a surface or in a room, building, town, city etc
place.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: Make sure you keep the key in a safe place.
I’ve spent the day dashing about from place to place.
The place was full of screaming children.
He was threatening to burn the place down.
She had never been back to the place where the accident happened.
The theatre bar was our usual meeting place.
We were living then in a place called Alberiga.
The wall was quite damp in places (=in some places).
Did the accident happen at your place of work (=the place where you work)?
The Great Mosque has been a place of worship for Muslims for centuries.
This is a great place for a holiday.
I couldn’t find a place to park.
place.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: a house or apartment where someone lives
place.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: They’ve got quite a big place on the outskirts of Leeds.
It took us ages to find a place to live.
He’s staying with us until he can find a place of his own.
Do you want to come back to my place for coffee?
place.translation[0].definitions[2].sign: space to sit or put something
place.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: a space where someone can sit, or a space where you can put something
place.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: I might arrive a bit late, so could you save me a place?
There are still a few places left on the coach.
Make sure you put everything back in its proper place.
Can you find a good place for this vase?
place.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: a point that you have reached in a book or a speech
place.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: This would be a good place to stop and answer any questions that people have.
I used a bookmark so that I wouldn’t lose my place (=forget the point that I had reached).
place.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: if someone has a place somewhere, they have the opportunity to go there or join in an activity
place.translation[0].definitions[4].exam: If you don’t come to training you might lose your place in the team.
We’ve been trying to find her a place in a residential home.
He was offered a place on the management committee.
There are still a couple of places left on the course.
I’ve been offered a place at York University.
place.translation[0].definitions[5].defi: the role or important position that someone or something has in a situation or in society
place.translation[0].definitions[5].exam: the old idea that a woman’s place is in the home
He finally reached the summit of Everest and secured his place in history.
Working has a very important place in all our lives.
place.translation[0].note_box[0].section: a meeting place
The club was a meeting place for musicians.
a hiding place
He had watched the farm workers from his hiding place.
a resting place
This tomb is the last resting place of the Davison family.
somebody’s place of birth
I need to know his date of birth, and his place of birth.
somebody’s place of work/employment
Please give the address of your place of work.
somebody’s place of residence
By law, you must inform us if you change your place of residence.
somebody’s/something’s place of origin
I believe my mother's place of origin was Sierra Leone.
a place of safety
His young son had been sent away to a place of safety.
a place of refuge
If ever you need a place of refuge, come to us.
a place of worship
The church is much more than a place of worship.
a place of pilgrimage
Her grave became a place of pilgrimage.
place.translation[0].note_box[1].section: a point or area, especially one that you visit or use for a particular purpose
He’s been to lots of places.
a good meeting place
the exact place where someone or something is, in relation to other things
She showed me the position of the village on the map.
I changed the position of the mirror slightly.
Jessica moved to a position where she could see the stage better.
a particular place on a line or surface
At this point the path gets narrower.
No cars are allowed beyond this point.
spot
a place, especially a particular kind of place, or a place where something happens. Spot sounds rather informal
She chose a sunny spot.
The area is a favourite spot for windsurfers.
This is the exact spot where I asked her to marry me.
location
a place where someone or something is, or where something happens. Location  sounds more formal than place
your exact location
The prisoners were taken to an undisclosed location.
an ideal location for a winter break
site
a place, especially one that will be used for a particular purpose, or where something important happened
the site of a great battle
There are plans to develop the site for housing.
The area has become a dumping site for nuclear waste.
venue
a place where something such as a meeting, concert, game etc takes place
the venue for the next Olympic Games
The hotel is a popular wedding venue.
scene
the place where something bad such as an accident or crime happened
the scene of the crime
Ambulance crews were at the scene within minutes.
setting
the place and the area around it, where something is or where something happens
The hotel is in a beautiful setting.
the setting for the film ‘A Room With a View’
Beautiful gardens provide the perfect setting for outdoor dining.
somewhere
used for talking about a place when you are not sure exactly which place
She came from somewhere in London.
whereabouts
the place where someone or something is – used especially when you do not know this or do not want to tell people
The whereabouts of the painting is unknown.
He refused to disclose his whereabouts.
I’m not sure about her whereabouts.
place.translation[0].note_box[2].heading: USAGE: Place, space
place.translation[0].note_box[2].items[0: You use place when talking about a particular position or location Place is always countable
place.translation[0].note_box[2].items[1: I found a place to put my boots
I found some place to put my boots
place.translation[0].note_box[2].items[2: You use space about the area that is available for doing something In this meaning, space is uncountable
place.translation[0].note_box[2].items[3: We don't have enough space for a washing machine
We don't have enough place for a washing machine
place.translation[0].note_box[2].items[4: The children need more space to play
The children need more place to play
place.translation[0].note_box[2].items[5: You also use space about an area that you can use for doing something In this meaning, space is countable
There are very few parking spaces left
I found a space at the back of the bus
place.translation[0].note_box[2].items[6: Someplace means ‘somewhere’ and is used especially in American English
I can't find my keys - I must have left them someplace
place.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to put something somewhere, especially with care
place.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: She poured the doctor a cup of tea and placed it on the table.
He carefully placed the folder back in his desk drawer.
place.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: to put someone or something in a particular situation
place.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: The government is being placed under pressure to give financial help to farmers.
Children must not be placed at risk.
Some areas of the city have been placed under curfew.
This places me in a very difficult position.
place.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: to find a suitable job or home for someone
place.translation[1].definitions[2].exam: Some unemployed people can be very difficult to place.
He was later placed with a foster family.
place.translation[1].definitions[3].defi: to arrange for something to be done
place.translation[1].definitions[3].exam: He placed an advertisement in the local paper.
You can place orders by telephone.
I had no idea which horse I should place a bet on.
place.translation[1].definitions[4].defi: to say how good or important you think someone or something is
place.translation[1].definitions[4].exam: I would place health quite high on my list of priorities.
Some museums seem to place profit above education.
place.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: to ask a shop or business to provide goods
place.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: The airline has placed a large order for jets with Boeing.
place.translation[2].definitions[1].defi: to ask a BROKER to buy shares, bonds etc for you
place.translation[2].definitions[1].exam: A speculator placed a large order for stock but couldn’t afford to pay for it.
place.translation[2].definitions[2].defi: if a financial institution acting for a company places its shares, bonds etc, they manage to sell them to investors
place.translation[2].definitions[2].exam: It easily placed the 16 million shares in the bank.
25% of the firm’s shares will be placed with institutional investors.
place.translation[2].definitions[3].defi: if an organization such as an EMPLOYMENT AGENCY places someone in a job, they find a job for them
place.translation[2].definitions[3].exam: The agency is not paid until the individual is placed in a job and holds it for a set amount of time.
place.translation[2].definitions[4].defi: to arrange for an advertisement to appear in a newspaper
place.translation[2].definitions[4].exam: He wanted to sell his car, so he placed an ad in the ‘Auto Trader’.
place.translation[2].definitions[5].defi: to give a telephone OPERATOR the number of a person you want to speak to, so that they can connect you
place.translation[2].definitions[5].exam: He went to the hotel to place two telephone calls, one local and one to London.
place.translation[2].definitions[6].defi: to ask a court of law to officially say that a company cannot continue to operate normally because of its financial difficulties
place.translation[2].definitions[6].exam: Creditor banks are considering cutting off assistance and forcing the company to be placed under receivership.
place.translation[3].definitions[0].defi: the office, factory etc where you work
place.translation[3].definitions[0].exam: Our place of work provides us with a base for social interaction.
place.translation[3].definitions[1].defi: to happen, especially after being planned or arranged
place.translation[3].definitions[1].exam: The meeting took place on 5th May.
place.translation[3].definitions[2].defi: if you do something in someone’s place, you do it instead of them because they cannot do it
place.translation[3].definitions[2].exam: John Hudson is away that week, so I will be attending the course in his place.
place.translation[3].definitions[3].exam: The market had just started to look as if it was going places when the crash came along.
place.translation[3].definitions[4].defi: in positions of power or authority
